mdRecord.dcterms:title: The south part of Great Britain, called, England and Wales: containing all ye cities, market towns, boroughs: and whatever places have ye election of members of parliament with ye names of ye rivers, seaports, sands, hills, moors, forests &c. All ye great or post roads, and principal cross-roads &c. with ye computed miles from town to town and ye post towns as they are at present regulated by the Postmasters Genl. of the General Post House, according to ye most approved surveys, and accurate observations / by Herman Moll Geographer. A.D. 1710
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Moll, Herman, -1732 [original]
mdRecord.dcterms:extent: 1 map : col. ; 60 x 97 cm. on sheet 63 x 104 cm.
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Advertisement. Having perused Mr. Ogilby's most useful survey of ye roads of south Britain, with his description of its rivers... [original]

Explanation: great or direct roads, principal cross roads, roads not to be found in Mr. Ogilby's book, computed miles..., cities, Archbishopricks, Bishoprikcs, parliament towns.., port towns or stages on the post roads (Note. This map may be useful without scale or compasses: for ye towns that are not touched by the roads lying near them, their distances may easily be computed by inspection.) [original]
Map image flanked on both sides by tables of towns and distances. [original]

Dedication: To the right honourable Francis Lord Viscount Rialton, son and heir apparent of the Right Honble. Sidney Earl of Godolphin &c. Lord High Treasurer of Great Britain. This map of south Britain is most Humbly Dedicated by your Lordship's most Humble Servant Herman Moll geographer. [original]
SPECIAL COLLECTIONS: "France" was written by mistake on verso; it was lined through and replaced with the correct title, "England." [original]
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Great Britain--Maps--Early works to 1800
England--Maps--Early works to 1800
Wales--Maps--Early works to 1800
